author: out.eth
content: if Alice sends a tx to the deposit contract with withdrawal credentials for a `eth1_withdrawal_address` then when Alice withdraws she only has to submit an eth transaction from that same `eth1_withdrawal_address`? She doesn't have to submit a signature using the private key of that address?

author: out.eth
content: Just double checking that you can set a smart contract as the withdrawal credentials and then the smart contract is the one that submits a withdraw transaction

author: djrtwo
content: currently, only the active bls key can *exit* from validation. Then the withdrawal would automatically be added to the withdrawal receipt tree. Then any eth1 addr can trigger the consumption of the receipt and the final movement of the eth into the eth1_withdrawal_addr

author: djrtwo
content: yes, you can set a smart contract as the withdrawal credentials. and yes, that smart contract could trigger the final withdrawal tx just as any address can.

author: djrtwo
content: as of now, an eth1 account/contract cannot *exit* validation on the beacon chain side
